meanings.definition: The action of dividing or splitting something into two or more parts.
meanings.sent1: The fission of the cake into slices was done carefully.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the fission of cells to understand growth.
meanings.sent3: During the party, the fission of the pinata brought joy to the children.
meanings.sent4: The fission of responsibilities among team members made the project successful.
meanings.sent5: The fission of the rock created a beautiful pattern.

meanings.definition: The process of a cell dividing into two or more daughter cells.
meanings.sent1: Cell fission is crucial for reproduction in organisms.
meanings.sent2: The fission of the egg cell leads to embryo development.
meanings.sent3: The fission of the jellybean in half surprised the child.
meanings.sent4: The fission of tasks among siblings made the chores easier.
meanings.sent5: The fission of the cloud into smaller clouds was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The splitting of an atomic nucleus into two or more smaller nuclei.
meanings.sent1: Nuclear fission is used in power plants to generate electricity.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the fission of atoms to understand energy release.
meanings.sent3: The fission of the watermelon at the picnic was messy but fun.
meanings.sent4: The fission of opinions in the meeting led to a heated debate.
meanings.sent5: The fission of the star created a spectacular explosion.
